direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with attribute presence and retrieval, but 'hasAttr' checks for presence while 'attr' retrieves the value.
Both methods handle attribute retrieval, but 'eachAttr' collects values from all elements while 'attr' retrieves from the first element with the attribute.
Both methods deal with attributes, but 'attr(String, String)' sets an attribute value while 'attr(String)' retrieves it.
Both methods interact with attributes, but 'removeAttr' removes the attribute while 'attr' retrieves or sets it.
Both methods modify element attributes, but 'addClass' modifies the 'class' attribute while 'attr' handles general attributes.
Both methods modify element attributes, but 'removeClass' removes a class from the 'class' attribute while 'attr' handles general attributes.
Both methods modify element attributes, but 'toggleClass' toggles a class in the 'class' attribute while 'attr' handles general attributes.
Both methods check for attribute presence, but 'hasClass' checks for a class in the 'class' attribute while 'attr' handles general attributes.
Both methods retrieve values from elements, but 'val' retrieves form element values while 'attr' retrieves attribute values.
Both methods set values on elements, but 'val(String)' sets form element values while 'attr(String, String)' sets attribute values.
Both methods retrieve content from elements, but 'text' retrieves text content while 'attr' retrieves attribute values.
Both methods check for content presence, but 'hasText' checks for text content while 'hasAttr' checks for attribute presence.
Both methods collect content from elements, but 'eachText' collects text content while 'eachAttr' collects attribute values.
Both methods retrieve content from elements, but 'html' retrieves inner HTML while 'attr' retrieves attribute values.
Both methods retrieve content from elements, but 'outerHtml' retrieves outer HTML while 'attr' retrieves attribute values.
Both methods modify element properties, but 'tagName' modifies the tag name while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods set content on elements, but 'html(String)' sets inner HTML while 'attr(String, String)' sets attribute values.
Both methods modify element content, but 'prepend' adds content at the start while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods modify element content, but 'append' adds content at the end while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods modify element content, but 'before' inserts content before the element while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods modify element content, but 'after' inserts content after the element while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods modify element structure, but 'wrap' wraps elements with HTML while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods modify element structure, but 'unwrap' removes parent elements while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods modify element content, but 'empty' removes all child nodes while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods modify element structure, but 'remove' removes elements from the DOM while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'select' filters elements based on a query while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'not' filters out elements based on a query while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'eq' retrieves a specific element by index while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'is' checks if elements match a query while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'next' retrieves the next sibling while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'next(String)' retrieves the next sibling matching a query while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'nextAll' retrieves all following siblings while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'nextAll(String)' retrieves all following siblings matching a query while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'prev' retrieves the previous sibling while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'prev(String)' retrieves the previous sibling matching a query while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'prevAll' retrieves all previous siblings while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'prevAll(String)' retrieves all previous siblings matching a query while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'parents' retrieves all parent elements while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'first' retrieves the first element while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'last' retrieves the last element while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'traverse' performs a depth-first traversal while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'filter' performs a depth-first filtering while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'forms' retrieves form elements while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'comments' retrieves comment nodes while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'textNodes' retrieves text nodes while 'attr' handles attributes.
Both methods interact with elements, but 'dataNodes' retrieves data nodes while 'attr' handles attributes.
